short_bio: MD. shawan Kabir is one of the popular chefs in Bangladesh, with over 18 years of experience in Cooking World.

food_recipes.cooking_method: 1 no.In a bowl,combine the sony sauce and cornstarch.Add the beef slices to the mixture and marinate for 15 minutes, #2 no. ingredients: Sour cream and salsa for serving
food_recipes.cooking_method: 1no. In a skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain any excess fat. 2no Add the taco seasoning to the cooked beef and stir well to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.3no .Warm the taco shells according to the package instructions.4no .Fill each taco shell with a portion of the seasoned ground beef. 5 no. with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and chopped cilantro.6 no,  the beef tacos with sour cream and salsa on the side..

ingredients: Hamburger buns and toppings of your choice (lettuce, tomato, cheese, etc.)
food_recipes.cooking_method: 1 no .In a bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, grated onion, minced garlic, beaten egg, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well.2no .Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into patties.3no .Preheat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the patties for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.4no. Toast the hamburger buns on the grill or in a toaster.5no.Assemble the burgers with your preferred toppings and serve.

short_bio: Dr. Gulzar: A renowned culinary expert and author who specializes in traditional Bangladeshi recipes.

ingredients: 1 pound beef (flank steak or sirloin), thinly sliced
food_recipes.cooking_method: 1no .In a bowl, combine soy sauce, oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, and cornstarch. Add the sliced beef and let it marinate for 15-20 minutes.2no .Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add garlic and ginger, sauté for 1 minute.3no.Add the marinated beef and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Remove from the pan and set aside.4no .In the same pan, stir-fry the broccoli florets until they are crisp-tender. Season with salt and pepper.5no .Return the beef to the pan, toss everything together, and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.6no .Serve hot with steamed rice.

short_bio: Chef Rownak: Known for her popular cooking show and website, she focuses on Bangladeshi and South Asian cuisine.

ingredients: 4 carrots, peeled and cut into chunks
4 potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
food_recipes.cooking_method: 1NO .Season the beef chuck roast generously with salt and pepper.2NO .Place the chopped onion, minced garlic, carrots, and potatoes in the bottom of a slow cooker.3no .In a separate bowl, combine the beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, dried thyme, and dried rosemary. Pour the mixture over the vegetables in the slow cooker.4no .Place the seasoned chuck roast on top of the vegetables and liquid.5no.Cover the slow cooker and cook on low heat for 8-10 hours or on high heat for 4-6 hours, until the beef is tender and easily shreds.6no.Remove the roast from the slow cooker and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing or shredding.7no .Serve the pot roast with the cooked vegetables and some of the cooking liquid as a sauce.8no .These are the first five recipes. Let me know if you'd like the rest of the recipes and instructions!

short_bio: Chef Tareq: A skilled chef and restaurateur who blends traditional Bangladeshi flavors with modern culinary techniques.

ingredients: Optional toppings: sesame seeds, chopped green onions
food_recipes.cooking_method: 1no .Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.2no .Add the sliced onion and minced garlic to the pan. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.3no .Add the bell pepper, carrot, zucchini, broccoli, snap peas, and mushrooms to the pan. Stir-fry the vegetables for about 5-7 minutes until they are tender-crisp. You can adjust the cooking time depending on how crunchy or soft you prefer your vegetables.4no .In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce and sesame oil. Pour the sauce over the vegetables in the pan and toss to coat evenly. Season with salt and pepper to taste.5no .Continue cooking for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are coated with the sauce and heated through.6no .Remove the pan from heat and transfer the stir-fried vegetables to a serving dish.7no .Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions if desired.8no .Your vegetable stir-fry is now ready to be served! You can enjoy it as is or pair it with steamed rice or noodles for a complete meal. Feel free to customize the recipe by adding your favorite vegetables or adjusting the seasonings to suit your taste.

short_bio: Chef Zakir: A household name in Bangladesh, he has a vast repertoire of recipes and has hosted numerous cooking shows.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as cauliflower florets, carrots, peas, bell peppers)
Cooked rice or naan bread (for serving)
food_recipes.cooking_method: 1no .Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat.2no .Add the chopped onion to the pan and sauté for 2-3 minutes until it becomes soft and translucent.3no .Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan. Sauté for another minute until fragrant.4no .In a small bowl, combine the curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and paprika. Add this spice mixture to the pan and stir well to coat the onions, garlic, and ginger.5no .Pour in the coconut milk, stirring to incorporate the spices into the milk. Let it simmer for 2 minutes.6no .Add the mixed vegetables, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth to the pan. Stir to combine all the ingredients.7no .Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat tolow. Cover the pan and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.8no .Season the curry with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust the seasonings and thickness of the sauce according to your preference.9n .Once the vegetables are cooked, remove the pan from heat. Garnish the curry with fresh chopped cilantro.10no.Serve the vegetable curry hot with steamed rice or naan bread.Enjoy your flavorful vegetable curry! You can customize the recipe by adding your favorite vegetables or adjusting the level of spiciness by adding chili powder or chili flakes.
